quiz_initialize_variable.Name: quiz_initialize_variable
quiz_initialize_variable.Description: How to initialize a global variable
quiz_initialize_variable.QuestionHTML: Define (initialize) a global variable named <font color="red"> $#STR1#$</font> and give it an initial value of <font color="red">-91.9</font>.
Hints: You will need an initialize block from the Variables drawer.
You will also need a number block from the Math drawer.
Pseudocode: Initialize global $#STR1#$ to -91.9
quiz_initialize_variable.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="87" y="27"><field name="NAME">$#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">-91.9</field></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_statements.Name: quiz_statements
quiz_statements.QuestionHTML: Write a setter statement that adds 1 to the global variable Z.
Hints: The setter block is in the Variables drawer.
You will also need a getter block in the Variables drawer.
Create an expression block for Z + 1 and plug it into the set global Z block.
Pseudocode: Set Z to Z + 1
quiz_statements.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="53" y="3"><field name="NAME">Z</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_statements.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="53" y="3"><field name="NAME">Z</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="56" y="48"><field name="VAR">global Z</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><field name="VAR">global Z</field></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_incrementing.Name: quiz_incrementing
quiz_incrementing.DisplayName: Statements: Add a number to a Global
quiz_incrementing.Description: How to add a number to a global variable
quiz_incrementing.QuestionHTML: Use a setter to increment global Z by -91.9.
Hints: The setter block is in the Variables drawer.
You will also need a getter block in the Variables drawer.
Create an expression block for Z + -91.9 and plug it into the set global Z block.
Pseudocode: Set Z to Z + -91.9
quiz_incrementing.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="1" y="-1"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">10</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_incrementing.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="1" y="-1"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">10</title></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="252" y="169"><title name="VAR">global Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global Z</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">-91.9</title></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_double_variable.Name: quiz_double_variable
quiz_double_variable.Description: How to double a global variable.
quiz_double_variable.QuestionHTML: Construct a block to double the value of $#STR1#$, which has initial value -91.9.
Hints: You'll need a setter block in the Variables drawer.
You'll need a math block in the Math drawer.
To double a variable, ether multiply it times 2 or add it to itself and assign the result back to the variable using the setter.
Pseudocode: Set $#STR1#$ to $#STR1#$ * 2
quiz_double_variable.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="36" y="-1"><field name="NAME">$#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">-91.9</field></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_double_variable.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="36" y="-1"><field name="NAME">$#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">-91.9</field></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="40" y="49"><field name="VAR">global $#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_multiply" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><field name="VAR">global $#STR1#$</field></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">2</field></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_random_number.Name: quiz_random_number
quiz_random_number.QuestionHTML: Assign a random number between -91.9 and -92.9 to the global variable $#STR1#$.
Hints: Use the <font color="red">random_integer_from_to</font> block in the Math drawer.
quiz_random_number.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="95" y="-7"><field name="NAME">$#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_random_number.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="95" y="-7"><field name="NAME">$#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="94" y="39"><field name="VAR">global $#STR1#$</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_random_int" inline="true"><value name="FROM"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">-91.9</field></block></value><value name="TO"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">-92.9</field></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_initialize.Name: quiz_initialize
quiz_initialize.QuestionHTML: Create a sequence of setter statements that sets the values of all global variables to 0.
Hints: You will need a setter block for each global variable. These are in the Variables drawer.
Each block should just set the global variable's value to 0.

Pseudocode: Set X to 0
Set Y to 0
quiz_initialize.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="40" y="14"><field name="NAME">X</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">10</field></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="44" y="54"><field name="NAME">Y</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">20</field></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_initialize.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="40" y="14"><field name="NAME">X</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">10</field></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="44" y="54"><field name="NAME">Y</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">20</field></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="76" y="109"><field name="VAR">global X</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field></block></value><next><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><field name="VAR">global Y</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field></block></value></block></next></block></xml>

quiz_background_color.Name: quiz_background_color
quiz_background_color.Description: Use a setter block to set the button's background color.
quiz_background_color.QuestionHTML: Complete the block shown here so that it sets Button1's BackgroundColor to red.
Hints: Color blocks are in the Colors drawer.
quiz_background_color.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="component_set_get" inline="false" x="72" y="27"><mutation set_or_get="set" component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" property_name="BackgroundColor" is_generic="false"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><field name="PROP">BackgroundColor</field></block></xml>
quiz_background_color.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="component_set_get" inline="false" x="56" y="13"><mutation set_or_get="set" component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" property_name="BackgroundColor" is_generic="false"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><field name="PROP">BackgroundColor</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="color_red"><field name="COLOR">#ff0000</field></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_set_line_width.Name: quiz_set_line_width
quiz_set_line_width.Description: Set the value of the Canvas's line width to five times the current dotsize, where dotsize is a global.
quiz_set_line_width.QuestionHTML: Given the global variable, dotsize, set the Canvasâ€™s LineWidth to five times the dotsize.
Hints: You can find the setter for LineWidth in the Canvas drawer.
Use the multiplication operator in the Math drawer.
You'll also need the getter block in the Variables drawer.
quiz_set_line_width.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="124" y="9"><title name="NAME">dotSize</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">2</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_set_line_width.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="117" y="11"><title name="NAME">dotSize</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">2</title></block></value></block><block type="Canvas1_setproperty" inline="false" x="117" y="66"><mutation yailtype="number"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Canvas1</title><title name="PROP">LineWidth</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_multiply" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global dotSize</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">5</title></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_text_color.Name: quiz_text_color
quiz_text_color.Description: Use a setter block to set a button's Text color property.
quiz_text_color.QuestionHTML: Use a setter block to set Button1's TextColor property to magenta.
Hints: You will need to drag Button1's setter block from the Button drawer to the workspace.
You will also need to select the TextColor property from the block's property mutator.
quiz_text_color.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="Button1_setproperty" inline="false" x="74" y="39"><mutation yailtype="number"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</title><title name="PROP">TextColor</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="color_magenta"><title name="COLOR">#ff00ff</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_simple_if_else.Name: quiz_simple_if_else
quiz_simple_if_else.Description: How to conditionally set a variable.
quiz_simple_if_else.QuestionHTML: Construct an if-else statement that adds 1 to the variable X if variable Y is greater than 0 and otherwise subtracts 1.
Hints: For the if-slot you'll need a greater-than block from the Math drawer.
For the do-slot you'll need to construct a statement that adds 1 to X.
For the else-slot you'll need to construct a statement that substracts 1 from X.
quiz_simple_if_else.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="200" y="1"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="204" y="39"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="controls_if" inline="false" x="212" y="85"><mutation else="1"></mutation></block></xml>
quiz_simple_if_else.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="200" y="1"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="204" y="39"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="controls_if" inline="false" x="202" y="85"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="math_compare" inline="true"><title name="OP">GT</title><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global Y</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_subtract" inline="true"><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.Name: quiz_if_x_greater_than_y
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.DisplayName: Statements: Use If/Else to Set a Label
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.QuestionHTML: Construct an if/else block that expresses the following statement: If the variable X is greater than the variable Y, then the word "Greater" should be assigned to Label1. Otherwise "Lesser" should be assigned. (Spelling counts.)
Hints: Values such as "Greater" are Text objects in the Text drawer.
The greater-than block is in the Math drawer.
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="108" y="3"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">100</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="333" y="4"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">100</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_eval_arithmetic.Name: quiz_eval_arithmetic
quiz_eval_arithmetic.QuestionHTML: Evaluate the expression and type your answer into the text box.
Hints: If the expression is too hard to do in your head, feel free to use a calculator.
To skip the problem, just hit the 'Submit' button. You'll be given the correct answer.
quiz_eval_arithmetic.Xmlgenerator: function xmlGenerator(xml,low, high, op){var ops = ['ADD', 'MINUS', 'MULTIPLY', 'DIVIDE', 'POWER'];var name1=''; var name2=''; var type = '';if (!op){op = ops[Math.floor(Math.random() * ops.length)];if (op == 'ADD'){name1='NUM0'; name2='NUM1'; type = 'math_add';}else if (op == 'MINUS'){name1='A';name2='B';type = 'math_subtract';} else if (op == 'MULTIPLY'){name1='NUM0';name2='NUM1';type = 'math_multiply'; } else if (op == 'DIVIDE') {name1='A';name2='B';type = 'math_division';} else {type = 'math_power';name1='A';name2='B';}}var n1 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10);var n2 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10);if (low && high) {n1 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1));n2 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1));}if (op == 'DIVIDE' && n2 == 0) {n2 = 1;}if (op == 'DIVIDE') {var factor = Math.floor(Math.random() * 5);n1 = n2 * factor;}if (op == 'POWER' && n2 > 3) {n2 = 3;}xml = xml.replace('$type', type);xml = xml.replace('$arg1', n1);xml = xml.replace('$arg2', n2);xml=xml.replace('$name1',name1);xml=xml.replace('$name2',name2);return xml; }
quiz_eval_arithmetic.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="$type" inline="true" x="85" y="100"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="$name1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$arg1</title></block></value><value name="$name2"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$arg2</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_eval_relations.Name: quiz_eval_relations
quiz_eval_relations.QuestionHTML: Evaluate the expression as true or false and type your answer into the text box.
Hints: You can skip the problem by hitting the 'Submit' button.  The correct answer will be displayed.
quiz_eval_relations.Xmlgenerator: function xmlGenerator(xml, low, high, op) {var ops = ['EQ', 'NEQ', 'LT', 'LTE', 'GT', 'GTE'];   if (!op) { op = ops[Math.floor(Math.random() * ops.length)]; } var n1 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); var n2 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); if (low && high) { n1 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); n2 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); } xml = xml.replace('$OP', op); xml = xml.replace('$N1', n1); xml = xml.replace('$N2', n2); return xml; }
quiz_eval_relations.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="math_compare"><title name="OP" >$OP</title><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$N1</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$N2</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Name: quiz_simple_relations_fillin
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Description: Simple binary relational fill in the block questions.
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.QuestionHTML: Complete the expression in any way you wish so that the resulting expression is true.
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Xmlgenerator: function xmlGenerator(xml, low, high, op) {var ops = ['EQ', 'NEQ', 'LT', 'LTE', 'GT', 'GTE']; if (!op) { op = ops[Math.floor(Math.random() * ops.length)]; } var n1 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); var n2 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); if (low && high) { n1 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); n2 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); } xml = xml.replace('$OP', op); xml = xml.replace('$N1', n1); xml = xml.replace('$N2', n2); return xml; }
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="math_compare"><title name="OP">$OP</title><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$N1</title></block></value></block><block type="math_number" x="85" y="55"><title name="NUM">$N2</title></block></xml>

quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Name: quiz_stop_player_if_playing
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Description: Simple if-else to start and stop the Player
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.QuestionHTML: Complete this Button.Click event handler so that it will stop the Player if it is already playing. Otherwise it will start the Player.
Hints: You'll need the appropriate purple blocks from the Player drawer.
Think about what action to "do" when the Player is playing.
Think about what action to "do" when the Player is not playing.
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Xmltemplate: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="component_event" x="133" y="15"><mutation component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" event_name="Click"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><statement name="DO"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="component_set_get"><mutation set_or_get="get" component_type="Player" instance_name="Player1" property_name="IsPlaying" is_generic="false"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field><field name="PROP">IsPlaying</field></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="component_event" x="132" y="26"><mutation component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" event_name="Click"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><statement name="DO"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="component_set_get"><mutation component_type="Player" set_or_get="get" property_name="IsPlaying" is_generic="false" instance_name="Player1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field><field name="PROP">IsPlaying</field></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="component_method"><mutation component_type="Player" method_name="Stop" is_generic="false" instance_name="Player1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="component_method"><mutation component_type="Player" method_name="Start" is_generic="false" instance_name="Player1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field></block></statement></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Name: quiz_if_else_stop_start_player
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.DisplayName: Control: If Else Stop Start Player
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Description: Construct an if/else block to start and stop the Player depending on whether it's already playing
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.QuestionHTML: Complete the Button1.Click event. It should pause the Player if it is already playing. Otherwise it should start the Player.
Hints: You'll need an if block in the Control drawer.
Use the mutator on the if block to add an else slot.
Use the drop-down widget on the Player1.isLooping block to select the Player1.isPlaying property.
You'll need the appropriate purple blocks from the Player drawer.
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Xmltemplate: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="component_event" x="133" y="15"><mutation component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" event_name="Click"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</title></block></xml>
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="component_event" x="132" y="26"><mutation component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" event_name="Click"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><statement name="DO"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="component_set_get"><mutation component_type="Player" set_or_get="get" property_name="IsPlaying" is_generic="false" instance_name="Player1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field><field name="PROP">IsPlaying</field></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="component_method"><mutation component_type="Player" method_name="Pause" is_generic="false" instance_name="Player1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="component_method"><mutation component_type="Player" method_name="Start" is_generic="false" instance_name="Player1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</field></block></statement></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_sum_a_list_procedure.Name: quiz_sum_a_list_procedure
quiz_sum_a_list_procedure.DisplayName: Control, Loop: Sum a list procedure
quiz_sum_a_list_procedure.QuestionHTML: Define sumAList() procedure that computes the sum of the values in myList and stores the result in sum.
Hints: You'll need a procedure definition block in the Procedures drawer. Use the first one.
You'll want to use a for each item loop for this problem.
Make sure you use the length function in the Lists drawer.
quiz_sum_a_list_procedure.Xmltemplate: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="global_declaration" id="74" inline="false" collapsed="true" x="88" y="17"><field name="NAME">myList</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="lists_create_with" id="94" inline="false"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="ADD0"><block type="math_number" id="109"><field name="NUM">3</field></block></value><value name="ADD1"><block type="math_number" id="110"><field name="NUM">7</field></block></value></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" id="119" inline="false" collapsed="true" x="87" y="56"><field name="NAME">sum</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number" id="120"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_sum_a_list_procedure.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="global_declaration" id="74" inline="false" collapsed="true" x="88" y="17"><field name="NAME">myList</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="lists_create_with" id="94" inline="false"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="ADD0"><block type="math_number" id="109"><field name="NUM">3</field></block></value><value name="ADD1"><block type="math_number" id="110"><field name="NUM">7</field></block></value></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" id="119" inline="false" collapsed="true" x="87" y="56"><field name="NAME">sum</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number" id="120"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" id="123" x="81" y="104"><mutation></mutation><field name="NAME">sumAList</field><statement name="STACK"><block type="controls_forEach" id="129" inline="false"><field name="VAR">item</field><value name="LIST"><block type="lexical_variable_get" id="135"><field name="VAR">global myList</field></block></value><statement name="DO"><block type="lexical_variable_set" id="141" inline="false"><field name="VAR">global sum</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" id="142" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get" id="148"><field name="VAR">global sum</field></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="lexical_variable_get" id="151"><field name="VAR">item</field></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_sum_a_list_function.Name: quiz_sum_a_list_function
quiz_sum_a_list_function.DisplayName: Control, Loop: Sum a List Function
quiz_sum_a_list_function.Description: Define a function to sum a list.
quiz_sum_a_list_function.QuestionHTML: Define a function named <font color="red">sumAList(list)</font> that takes a list parameter and returns (as a result) the sum of the values in the list.
Hints: You'll need a procedure definition block in the Procedures drawer. Use the second one.
You'll need a for each item loop block in the Controls drawer.
Use a local variable for this problem to store the sum within the function.
To use the for each loop in a function, you will need to put it inside a do..result block from the Controls drawer.

quiz_calculate_hit_rate.Name: quiz_calculate_hit_rate
quiz_calculate_hit_rate.DisplayName: Procedures: Define Procedure to Calculate Hit Rate
quiz_calculate_hit_rate.QuestionHTML: Using the pre-defined global variables, define a procedure named calculateHitRate that calculates the player's hit percentage, which is defined as: hitRate = hits / (hits + misses).
Hints: You'll need the procedure do block in the Procedures drawer.
Your procedure should set the value of the global hitRate variable.
Build your math expression using blocks in the Math drawer

quiz_hello_purr.Description: Add a Sound.Vibrate block to the Button.Click procedure.
quiz_hello_purr.QuestionHTML: Update the blocks shown here so that when the button is clicked, the phone vibrates for 500 milliseconds (ms) after the sound is played.
Hints: Look in the 'Sound' drawer for the Sound.Vibrate block.

The open slot in the Sound.Vibrate block represents the duration of the vibration in milliseconds (thousandths of a second).

quiz_button_click_disable_button.Name: quiz_button_click_disable_button
quiz_button_click_disable_button.DisplayName: Event Handler: Button Click Disable Button
quiz_button_click_disable_button.Description: A button click event handler that disables itself.
quiz_button_click_disable_button.QuestionHTML: Put together all the blocks necessary to handle a button click event on Button1. When Button1 is clicked, the app should disable Button1.
Hints: You'll need the Button.Click event handler in the Button drawer.
You'll need the green property setter block from Button drawer.
Use the drop-down menu on the setter block to choose the Enabled property.
There is no Disabled property. So 'disabled' means that Enabled is false. Check the Logic drawer for the value false.
quiz_button_click_disable_button.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="component_event" x="60" y="41"><mutation component_type="Button" instance_name="Button1" event_name="Click"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><statement name="DO"><block type="component_set_get" inline="false"><mutation component_type="Button" set_or_get="set" property_name="Enabled" is_generic="false" instance_name="Button1"></mutation><field name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</field><field name="PROP">Enabled</field><value name="VALUE"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_trivial_function.Name: quiz_trivial_function
quiz_trivial_function.QuestionHTML: Define f() = 0. That is, define a function named f that takes no parameters and returns 0.
Hints: This is a hint
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_null_function.Name: quiz_null_function
quiz_null_function.QuestionHTML: Define f(x) = 0. That is, define a function named f that takes 1 parameter and returns 0.
Hints: This is a hint
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_comma-delimited_lat_long.Name: quiz_comma-delimited_lat_long
quiz_comma-delimited_lat_long.Description: A function to generate a comma-delimited lat long string
quiz_comma-delimited_lat_long.QuestionHTML: Define a function named makeLatLongString(lat,long) that takes two parameters, a lat and a long, and produces a comma-delimited string 'lat,long'.
Hints: You'll need the procedures-with-return block in the Procedures drawer. It's the second block.
Use the mutator (the blue widget) to add two parameters to the definition. You can name them whatever you like.
You'll probably want to use the join block in the Text drawer to perform concatenation.
Construct the appropriate calculation and put it in the result slot.
quiz_comma-delimited_lat_long.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="procedures_defreturn" id="78" inline="false" x="66" y="93"><mutation><arg name="lat"></arg><arg name="long"></arg></mutation><field name="NAME">makeLatLongString</field><field name="VAR0">lat</field><field name="VAR1">long</field><value name="RETURN"><block type="text_join" id="75" inline="false"><mutation items="3"></mutation><value name="ADD0"><block type="lexical_variable_get" id="90"><field name="VAR">lat</field></block></value><value name="ADD1"><block type="text" id="100"><field name="TEXT">,</field></block></value><value name="ADD2"><block type="lexical_variable_get" id="93"><field name="VAR">long</field></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_hello_function.Name: quiz_hello_function
quiz_hello_function.Description: Write a function that performs a concatenation.
quiz_hello_function.QuestionHTML: Define a function named hello(x) that concatenates the word 'hello' and the parameter x, with a space in between. For example hello("world") would result in "hello world".
Hints: You'll need the procedures-with-return block in the Procedures drawer. It's the second block.
Use the mutator (the blue widget) to add a parameter to the definition.
You'll probably want to use the join block in the Text drawer.
Construct the appropriate calculation and put it in the result slot.
quiz_hello_function.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="procedures_defreturn" id="70" inline="false" x="128" y="28"><mutation><arg name="x"></arg></mutation><field name="NAME">hello</field><field name="VAR0">x</field><value name="RETURN"><block type="text_join" id="80" inline="false"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="ADD0"><block type="text" id="87"><field name="TEXT">hello </field></block></value><value name="ADD1"><block type="lexical_variable_get" id="90"><field name="VAR">x</field></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_double_function.Name: quiz_double_function
quiz_double_function.QuestionHTML: Write a function, double(x), that doubles the value of its single argument.
Hints: You'll need a to-procedure-return block in the Procedures drawer.
Place an expression that doubles the value of the parameter into the return slot.

quiz_function_square.Name: quiz_function_square
quiz_function_square.QuestionHTML: Define a function named square(x) that has one parameter, x, and calculates the square of x.
Hints: You'll need the procedures-with-return block in the Procedures drawer. It's the second block.
Use the mutator (the blue widget) to add a parameter to the definition.
You'll need the multiplication operator from the Math drawer.
Construct the appropriate calculation and put it in the result slot.

quiz_is_odd.Name: quiz_is_odd
quiz_is_odd.QuestionHTML: Write a function <font color="red">isOdd(x)</font> that returns true if its argument is an odd number. Do not use if/else.
Hints: You'll need a to-procedure-return block in the Procedures drawer.
You can put the is-odd expression right into the return slot.
In pseudocode, isOdd(x):  (x mod 2) = 1

quiz_is_divisible_by.Name: quiz_is_divisible_by
quiz_is_divisible_by.QuestionHTML: Define a function 'isDivisibleBy(x,y)' that returns true if x is evenly divisible by y. Otherwise it returns false.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_simple_function.Name: quiz_simple_function
quiz_simple_function.QuestionHTML: Write a function, h(x,y), that returns the sum of the numbers from x to y inclusive.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_pounds_to_kilograms.Name: quiz_pounds_to_kilograms
quiz_pounds_to_kilograms.QuestionHTML: Write a function <font color="red">lbsToKg(x)</font> that converts pounds to kg.  I kg = 2.2 pounds.
Hints: You'll need the procedures-with-return block in the Procedures drawer. It's the second block.
Use the mutator (the blue widget) to add a parameter to the definition.
You'll probably want to use the division operator from the Math drawer.
Construct the appropriate calculation and put it in the result slot.

quiz_quarts_to_gallons.Name: quiz_quarts_to_gallons
quiz_quarts_to_gallons.QuestionHTML: Define a function 'quartsToGallons(x)', with one parameter representing amount in quarts, that returns the amount in gallons, where 1 gal. = 4 qts.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_cups_to_tablespoons.Name: quiz_cups_to_tablespoons
quiz_cups_to_tablespoons.QuestionHTML: Write a function cupsToTablespoons that converts cups to tbsp using 1 cup = 16 tbsps.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_hypotenuse.Name: quiz_hypotenuse
quiz_hypotenuse.QuestionHTML: Define a function named hypotenuse(a,b) that calculates the length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of its other two sides, a and b.
Hints: You'll need a to-procedure-return block from the Procedures drawer
The calculation for the hypotenuse can go right in the return slot.
In pseudocode, hypotenuse = sqrt(a^2 + b^2).

quiz_sqrt_of_average.Name: quiz_sqrt_of_average
quiz_sqrt_of_average.QuestionHTML: Define a function named sqrtOfAverage(x,y) that takes the squareroot of the average of its 2 arguments, x and y.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.

quiz_recursive_sum.Name: quiz_recursive_sum
quiz_recursive_sum.QuestionHTML: Write a recursive function, sum(n), that computes the sum of 1..n.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.
quiz_recursive_sum.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="procedures_defreturn" inline="false" x="133" y="31"><mutation><arg name="n"></arg></mutation><title name="NAME">sum</title><value name="RETURN"><block type="controls_choose" inline="false"></block></value></block></xml>
